ygData.subject: Re: Extra Money (Actually - some language stuff)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I play an Erudite Wizard (level 14 now) and have trained my Elvish and Barbarian up to excellent without spending a single practice point in them
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 10 May 1999, Stefan Raets wrote:
> > Like many skills, at
> > least 1 point must be spent to begin learning the language.
>
> I used to think this was the case too, but my ranger friend has
> started picking up Old Erudian without putting a single point of
> practice into it. Beats me how it happened. I bet it will take a lot
> longer to even get 1 skillpoint this way though.

I play an Erudite Wizard (level 14 now) and have trained my Elvish and
Barbarian up to excellent without spending a single practice point in them
(actually, those languages aren't available at my guild). The first skill
point is not that long to obtain, not longer than the others really, I
think it's a waste of practice to actually train in languages, except if
you can't find anybody who speaks the language.
